p: Instructively, there is a tendency for climate change to bring wide-scale disruptions to the global community just like during COVID-19. This has revealed the world’s ill-preparedness in managing rapid, environmental risks induced by climate change in an interconnected world (Manzanedo and Manning 2020; Ringsmuth et al. 2022). Africa’s survival from COVID-19 and its performance better than earlier projections by experts has not been fully discussed in a way that could enable the world to learn lessons. Even considering its reliance on the global community which often inspires a lack of confidence in its systems within and outside the continent (Happi and Nkengasong 2022; Maeda and Nkengasong 2021; Walker et al. 2020).
